DOC.brief_summary: Rationale : End-stage congestive heart failure serious invalidate condition poor prognosis increase incidence . Non-randomized observation show peritoneal dialysis ( PD ) patient improve clinically NYHA stadium III-IV low NYHA stadium I-II . A randomized trial need test whether PD improve symptom condition find optimal scheme . Objective : To improve symptomatology severe chronic failure patient . Study design : Open , parallel intervention trial compare 2 scheme peritoneal dialysis icodextrin ( Extraneal® ) standard medical therapy.. Study population : Patients chronic refractory leave ventricular congestive heart failure ( LVEF < 30 % , old 18 year ) . Intervention : Peritoneal dialysis one ( night ) two ( night day ) dwell icodextrin ( Extraneal® ) . Main study parameters/endpoints : Reduction NYHA classification symptomatic Congestive Heart Failure 8 month start PD therapy . Burden congestive heart failure : measure reduction unfavorable day ( noted patient diary include day hospitalization CHF-deterioration death ) .
DOC.criteria: Age > 18 year Refractory Left Ventricular Congestive Heart Failure : LVEF < 30 % Diminished renal function : eGFR < 60 ml/min Clinically volume overload ( Dyspnoea ( NYHA IIIIV ) , edema , and/or ascites ) Hospitalization CHF last 6 month Patient optimal cardiologic medical therapy , stable 4 week Suitable PD Hypotension ( SBP < 100 mmHg / MAP < 70 ) mmHg Instable AP recent ( < 6 month ) myocardial infarction . Contraindications PD ( e.g . visual handicap , social ) Liver failure COPD Gold class IV Malignancy life expectancy < 2 year Non compliance No inform consent Poor mental health
